alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 5:46PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...TROPICAL DISTURBANCE TO PASS NEAR GUAM THIS WEEKEND... A tropical disturbance, Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC) Invest 98W is expected to pass through the region to the south of Guam Saturday night into Sunday. It now looks likely that the system will undergo little to no strengthening as it moves through. Therefore, the threat of a tropical depression is extremely low. Locally heavy showers remain a possibility, though total rainfall amounts of around 2 inches are expected across the Marianas. Although 98W is not expected to become a significant tropical cyclone as it approaches Guam, this could change. Residents of the Marianas should continue to monitor these changing conditions over the next few days and watch for any updates to the forecast. Unless conditions change significantly, this will be the last Special Weather Statement on Invest 98W. Follow these links for the latest forecast information: Public Forecast - https://forecast.weather.gov/product.php?site=gum& issuedby=gum&product=ZFP Marine forecast - https://forecast.weather.gov/product.php?site=gum& issuedby=gum&product=CWF Surf forecast - https://forecast.weather.gov/product.php?site=gum& issuedby=gum&product=SRF
